citation.article-title: Terriglobus saanensis sp. nov., an acidobacterium isolated from tundra soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Terriglobus saanensis sp. nov.
Terriglobus saanensis (sa.a.nen′sis. N.L. masc. adj. saanensis pertaining to Mount Saana, Finland).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, aerobic rods, ~0.5–0.7×1.5–3.0 µm.
Colonies on R2A agar are light beige to light pink, circular, convex and smooth.
Growth occurs at 4–30 °C and pH 4.5–7.5, with optimum growth at 25 °C and pH 6.
Hydrolyses starch, pectin, laminarin and aesculin but not gelatin, cellulose, xylan, lichenan, sodium alginate, pullulan, chitosan or chitin.

Utilizes the following substrates when tested in API 50 CH and API 20 NE systems and/or as 10 mM suspensions in VL55 buffer supplemented with yeast extract (100 mg l−1): N-acetylglucosamine, cellobiose, d-fructose, d-galactose, gentiobiose, d-glucose, lactose, d-mannose, melezitose, melibiose, l-rhamnose, raffinose, d-ribose, sucrose, turanose and d-xylose.

Does not utilize acetate, adipate, adonitol, amygdalin, arbutin, d- or l-arabinose, d- or l-alanine, caprate, citrate, dulcitol, erythritol, formate, d-fucose, gluconate, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, sodium glucuronate, sodium glutamate, glycerol, glycogen, d-glycine, inositol, inulin, l-leucine, d-lyxose, malate, mannitol, methyl d-mannoside, methyl d-glucoside, methyl xyloside, l-ornithine, l-sorbose, d-sorbitol, d-tagatose, trehalose or xylitol.

Produces acid and alkaline phosphatase, leucine arylamidase, α-chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-B1-phosphohydrolase, α- and β-galactosidase, α- and β-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, β-glucuronidase, α-fucosidase and α-mannosidase but not esterase, lipase, trypsin, valine or cystine arylamidase.
The major cellular fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 1ω7c, iso-C13 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The type strain, SP1PR4T ( = DSM 23119T = ATCC BAA-1853T), was isolated from soil samples collected from a wind-exposed ridge of Mt. Saana, Finland.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 57.3 mol%.
